Don't get me wrong, this game was great. It was a very creative way of telling a story, I loved the art, and it was packed with emotion... until the final chapter. (spoilers if you haven't played the game yet) At the end, when you are given the choice to turn back or move on, no matter what you choose, it just didn't have a lot of emotional impact. It just shows one frame of them walking away or talking, and that's it. I wish that it had showed a bit more of what happened afterwards. Maybe if they get back together, they go stargazing again, and if they stayed apart, it would show more development from chapter 4. I also would've liked to see more choice in the story, like you could choose what to say when they're arguing or something similar. Overall, I just would've liked to see a slightly longer play experience with more in-depth choices.

So I‚Äôm at a sleep over with my friends and I decided to play this while I was here with her. We are both open minded about same gender relationships. When I was going through we were talking about the game and even though it was a short game and there is really no voices spoken, it hits you in such a way that you want to cry. For a good reason or a bad is up to the player to decide, but this game, though short was one of the best experiences I‚Äôve ever had in a short game. This hit me just right and changed my view on a few things. Amazing game. Very pretty, very well done. 1million stars
this game kinda helped me realize to move on. it seems cheesy but it‚Äôs true. i wasn't expecting to bawl at the end of the game, but i definitely did. i love this game so much :)

title.label: I loved this short little game!!!

content.label: I know this was a really short game, and I didn't mind it that much, it's adorable and at the same time realistic, though it was really sad at the end and I could feel my heart shatter, great job on making it, the art style is also very creative, along with the coloring.

It took this game a mere 15 minutes to become the owner of my entire heart. Beautiful but I need to go cry myself to sleep now knowing that there isn‚Äôt a continuation. BUT I would literally jump for joy if there is a part two...Overall, I love it. Yalls should try it out...and that, my friends, that‚Äôs on peridot.
